{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3330828,"name":"Adam Pullen","username":"Adam_6877","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/adam_6877/{size}/196524_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-12T03:48:01.214Z","cooked":"

My team’s primary scoring mechanism keeps breaking only a few days before competition. We are using two 100:1 Planetary Sport Gearboxes to rotate an arm scoring Notes into the Amp.

Initially, the arm was programmed using encoders to set its position when a button was pressed. However, there was a good chance of the arm falling because of gravity (confusing the encoder) and essentially crunching itself on the hardstop.

Now, I am driving the motors manually, with a joystick.

There is plenty of torque, and the arm works great for a short time. But…

After a fair amount of abuse, if the arm accelerates/decelerates too fast or is pressed too hard against the hardtop there will be a loud snap and a no longer functioning arm. One of the planetary stages in the gearbox will have broken pins that previously held the gears on that stage.

What can we do to get the arm consistently working for competion?

I have ideas: (second hardstop for up arm position, spring to counteract gravity, slower joystick?) But keep in mind we only have a day or two to get this working. Thanks!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-03-12T04:00:09.602Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":231,"reads":448,"readers_count":447,"score":1254.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":458372,"topic_slug":"robot-arm-gearbox-repeatedly-collapsing","display_username":"Adam Pullen","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54344,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/robot-arm-gearbox-repeatedly-collapsing/458372/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3330839,"name":"EricH","username":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-12T04:03:33.638Z","cooked":"
Adam_6877:

if the arm accelerates/decelerates too fast or is pressed too hard against the hardtop there will be a loud snap and a no longer functioning arm. One of the planetary stages in the gearbox will have broken pins that previously held the gears on that stage.

For the hardstop: Mount a limit switch and do a small bit of code so that when the hardstop is reached, the Rio will detect the limit switch triggering and prevent the motors from continuing to drive through the hardstop. (Also, if space allows: put a bumper on said hardstop.)

For the acceleration, see if your programmers can put a limit on acceleration.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-03-12T04:05:40.024Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":417,"readers_count":416,"score":118.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":458372,"topic_slug":"robot-arm-gearbox-repeatedly-collapsing","display_username":"EricH","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4212,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"#westandwithUkraine"},"post_url":"/t/robot-arm-gearbox-repeatedly-collapsing/458372/2","custom_user_title":"#westandwithUkraine","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3330872,"name":"Penn Carbo","username":"noreason","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/noreason/{size}/179470_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-12T05:36:01.706Z","cooked":"

It looks like your arm is directly driven via a live axle hex hub straight from the planetary gearbox.

The issue here isn’t the ratio of your gearboxes, it’s the leverage (in physics terms, torque, that they’re able to apy onto it. A “live axle”hex hub like you guys have will effectively apply torque around 0.25 inches from the rotation point on a half inch hex shaft, because it’s being driven straight from the gearbox.

Many teams (including mine in 2022 after we encountered a similar problem and had to redesign) drive their arms with 60 or 64 tooth sprockets, which have a diameter of around 5-7 inches.

A 7 inch diameter sprocket will apply torque around 3.5 inches from the rotation point of the hex shaft.

Using the basic principles of Torque=force*distance, we can determine that your arm setup requires 14 times as much force to move the arm. Andymark gearboxes are tough, but not tough enough to withstand forces like that.

I understand it’s difficult to redesign late into the season, but I would recommend using a chain driven setup with sprockets. You can use the exact same gearboxes, but they will use chain to drive sprockets bolted to the arms which have much more torque on the arms they move. I would also recommend “cheese-holeing” the arm if you haven’t already by using a bearing hole sized (or larger) drill bit to make lightening holes in a pattern on your arm. The slight decrease in strength of the arm will be made up by making it far easier and more durable when rotating thanks to being much lighter.

I hope this helps, arms can be more difficult than they seem but once you better understand the forces involved you should be on the right track towards success.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-03-12T05:36:01.706Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":391,"readers_count":390,"score":188.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":458372,"topic_slug":"robot-arm-gearbox-repeatedly-collapsing","display_username":"Penn Carbo","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":10}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53310,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/robot-arm-gearbox-repeatedly-collapsing/458372/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":7},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":10,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3330874,"name":"Max Morehead","username":"Max_Morehead","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/max_morehead/{size}/231937_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-12T05:44:05.515Z","cooked":"

If you’re using NEO 550s (as depicted in the CAD), the gearboxes should be within their torque ratings even at stall, so it’s likely that damage is caused by shock loading (i.e. sudden loads far above the calculated maximum static loads). Adding a chain run between the motor and the arm pivot (even at 1:1, but preferably at a reduction) would help reduce the shock loading seen by the gearboxes because chain stretches.

Are you using a NEO 550 like the CAD says?

The other thing you could do is set a current limit or otherwise limit the max acceleration/output of the arm motors in code.

The ideas of a spring and a slower joystick you suggested, would both probably help a lot.

Adam_6877:

gravity (confusing the encoder) and essentially crunching itself on the hardstop.

This doesn’t make sense to me. How was gravity confusing the encoder?

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-03-12T14:59:06.314Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":326,"readers_count":325,"score":150.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":458372,"topic_slug":"robot-arm-gearbox-repeatedly-collapsing","display_username":"Max Morehead","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53784,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/robot-arm-gearbox-repeatedly-collapsing/458372/4","custom_user_title":"Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3330890,"name":"Adam Pullen","username":"Adam_6877","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/adam_6877/{size}/196524_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-12T07:04:03.204Z","cooked":"
Max_Morehead:

Are you using a NEO 550 like the CAD says?

Correct, we are using a Neo 550.

Max_Morehead:

How was gravity confusing the encoder?

Automating the arm with PID was pretty cool, but while the arm is in its “Up Position” (120°), it slowly rotates down to say 140° and the encoder value remains 120°.

The problem occurs when the arm moves back to what it thinks is “0” but is actually 20°. This could be solved with a simple hard stop in the Up position.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-03-12T07:04:03.204Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":281,"readers_count":280,"score":66.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":458372,"topic_slug":"robot-arm-gearbox-repeatedly-collapsing","display_username":"Adam Pullen","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54344,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/robot-arm-gearbox-repeatedly-collapsing/458372/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3330989,"name":"Patrick","username":"Patrick3357","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/patrick3357/{size}/169915_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-12T12:46:58.909Z","cooked":"

Something to counterbalance the weight of the arm is definitely a good idea, and will probably be the fastest to implement, but if/when you have time, put the arm on a dead axle and add another reduction with large sprockets bolted directly to the arms.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-03-12T12:46:58.909Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":232,"readers_count":231,"score":81.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":458372,"topic_slug":"robot-arm-gearbox-repeatedly-collapsing","display_username":"Patrick","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52597,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Build mentor"},"post_url":"/t/robot-arm-gearbox-repeatedly-collapsing/458372/6","custom_user_title":"Build mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3331000,"name":"Patrick Freivald","username":"pfreivald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pfreivald/{size}/177405_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-12T12:56:16.633Z","cooked":"

Yes, that; if you can put in anything to help give the arm “neutral buoyancy”, your motors won’t have to exert nearly as much torque and you can take a lot of strain off those itty-bitty planetary gears. It might look goofy, but springs and pulleys on a superstructure are an option for helping an arm move the way it needs to without doing a massive redesign or trying to get the exact force/motion necessary with gas struts.

I second (or third) the notion of adding in some chain or belt between your gearboxes and the axle you’re driving, preferably with some gear reduction. This will again reduce the load on those planetary gears, and reduce any shock load as well.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-03-12T12:59:15.414Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":224,"readers_count":223,"score":44.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":458372,"topic_slug":"robot-arm-gearbox-repeatedly-collapsing","display_username":"Patrick Freivald","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":52597,"username":"Patrick3357","name":"Patrick","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/patrick3357/{size}/169915_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7547,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC Mentor at Large"},"post_url":"/t/robot-arm-gearbox-repeatedly-collapsing/458372/7","custom_user_title":"FRC Mentor at Large","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3331002,"name":"","username":"Thor5090","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thor5090/{size}/226064_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-12T12:57:32.833Z","cooked":"
Max_Morehead:

This doesn’t make sense to me. How was gravity confusing the encoder?

Im sure it was having issues because they are using a 550 which was never meant to hold or brake that type of force. Im really surprised they haven’t burned up a couple 550s already. It really need another reduction with external gears or a chain and sprocket. I hate chain but it will absorb the shock load better. They could try max planetaries and a full size neo and it might work if the arm is light enough and if they use gas struts possibly

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-03-12T12:57:32.833Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":212,"readers_count":211,"score":47.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":458372,"topic_slug":"robot-arm-gearbox-repeatedly-collapsing","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53198,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"My views are mine and mine alone"},"post_url":"/t/robot-arm-gearbox-repeatedly-collapsing/458372/8","custom_user_title":"My views are mine and mine alone","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3331005,"name":"Patrick Freivald","username":"pfreivald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pfreivald/{size}/177405_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-12T13:00:02.532Z","cooked":"

This is the kind of application a Banebots p80 is good for. They’re planetary, but they’re absolute tanks. (They’re also very bulky and very heavy).

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-03-12T13:00:02.532Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":198,"readers_count":197,"score":89.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":458372,"topic_slug":"robot-arm-gearbox-repeatedly-collapsing","display_username":"Patrick Freivald","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":53198,"username":"Thor5090","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thor5090/{size}/226064_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7547,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC Mentor at Large"},"post_url":"/t/robot-arm-gearbox-repeatedly-collapsing/458372/9","custom_user_title":"FRC Mentor at Large","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3331010,"name":"","username":"Thor5090","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thor5090/{size}/226064_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-12T13:05:39.924Z","cooked":"

I wasn’t even sure Bane Bots was still in business. Everytime we’ve tried to contact them we get no response

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-03-12T13:05:57.041Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":189,"readers_count":188,"score":47.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":458372,"topic_slug":"robot-arm-gearbox-repeatedly-collapsing","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":7547,"username":"pfreivald","name":"Patrick Freivald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pfreivald/{size}/177405_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53198,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"My views are mine and mine alone"},"post_url":"/t/robot-arm-gearbox-repeatedly-collapsing/458372/10","custom_user_title":"My views are mine and mine alone","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3331039,"name":"Penn Carbo","username":"noreason","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/noreason/{size}/179470_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-12T13:56:32.291Z","cooked":"

The banebots gearboxes are still actively sold as “cim sport” gearboxes through andymark, so they’re still common on teams that primarily purchase parts through them.

And the mechanism in the Speaker that sorts and counts NOTES uses a couple BaneBots gearboxes and CIMs (if I remember the stickers on it correctly).

What encoder are you using? That doesn’t sound like the right behavior for an absolute encoder.

No matter what you do, I’d recommend a top hard stop. We added ours, 3/16 steel bolts though our drive sprockets, and needed them a week later when a command error caused the arm to attempt to escape from the robot. The arm bent the bolts. It keeps the robot from damaging itself, the field, or anything else fragile nearby.

And I totally agree, we will add a top hardstop today.

","post_number":15,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-03-12T14:38:12.240Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":14,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":144,"readers_count":143,"score":58.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":458372,"topic_slug":"robot-arm-gearbox-repeatedly-collapsing","display_username":"Pat Mattin","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.revrobotics.com/rev-11-1271/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Through Bore Encoder - REV Robotics","clicks":1},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/1/e/1e7c2e7afef90ae0fd3b6f200f877fde8abe76ca.jpeg","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":54344,"username":"Adam_6877","name":"Adam Pullen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/adam_6877/{size}/196524_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":27664,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Cheesecake Enthusiast"},"post_url":"/t/robot-arm-gearbox-repeatedly-collapsing/458372/15","custom_user_title":"Cheesecake Enthusiast","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3331081,"name":"Van DanderWide","username":"Van_DanderWide","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/v/e47774/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-12T14:53:14.230Z","cooked":"

I don’t think the 100+:1 planetary gearboxes can take the forces of a 20" lever during the rigors of FRC impact for long. The 550 Encoder only knows the position of the motor. It does not know the position of the arm. It probably jumps a tooth in the up direction, then drives into your hardstop and breaks a pin. Definitely need a limit switch the stop the motor on any hardstop.
As mentioned, for this application the last reduction should be with chain or belt.
You might reduce the damage for a while by countering the gravity value with a gas spring or torsion spring if you can fit them in.

We bought a couple of 100:1 p80s directly from Banebots two years ago. Ordered online, shipped the same day.

I’d also worry about the arm taking a hit and the force being transferred directly to the gearboxes. There’s some potential for damage there, especially with lateral forces.

","post_number":18,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-03-12T19:26:27.000Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":102,"readers_count":101,"score":50.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":458372,"topic_slug":"robot-arm-gearbox-repeatedly-collapsing","display_username":"Pat Mattin","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":27664,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Cheesecake Enthusiast"},"post_url":"/t/robot-arm-gearbox-repeatedly-collapsing/458372/18","custom_user_title":"Cheesecake Enthusiast","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3332110,"name":"Rod","username":"Weldingrod1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/weldingrod1/{size}/162109_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-13T16:03:36.760Z","cooked":"

Setting your ramp time to a lower Volts per second will reduce the shock loads on your arm; try 5 to 10 Volts per second as a starting point.

Setting your current limits nearer to the minimum required to lift the arm from horizontal will help the loads a lot.

We did both of those on our Rev-90 driven intake to avoid munching ANOTHER gearbox…
